intro: Hesperis abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and branching. Hesperis abyssinica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators in its native range.
